text:
For thinking people; ah, the great debate on climate change. 

One way to test whether this is an honest exchange of facts and ideas is to to seed these sites with facts and ideas that either support the narrative, or contest it.  I have done this over the last week on at least forty of the major taking one side or  the other.  

What I found is that usually within 48 hours, anything I say that doesn't support global warming as a crisis is removed, or edited down to only language that is supportive, while anything  post that would support the argument stays.  Makes one wonder where the money is coming from...

From NASA:¬† Based on orbital variations, Milankovitch predicted that the¬†ice age¬†would peak every 100,000 and 41,000 years, with additional ‚Äúblips‚Äù every 19,000 to 23,000 years. Three variables of the Earth's orbit‚Äîeccentricity, obliquity, and¬†‚Äîaffect global climate. But it's a lot more complicated than that.  

And, the last ice age was about 30,000 years ago. Interestingly humans didn't do so well because it's hard to migrate and one can show that there were less than 30,000 humans that survived through mitochondrial DNA analysis.  Whales, insects and such do much better and have been doing so for 100's of millions of years.

So, I totally believe in climate change... It's been going on for 100's of millions of years, since planet formation.¬† Long before humans arrived;  and yep, the ice caps melt, ocean levels change and humanity gets huge disruptions, then everything freezes up and people must move south to survive.



And, finally any huge heroic effort by humanity to change things one way or another would take another 100k years (one cycle) to measure the effect. 

I'll wait a few days and see which if any of my comments survive whoever has time and access to edit or eliminate my input.

It's pretty easy to get the impression that the narrative is being used as a political tool to try and get vast groups of people behind yet another 'crisis', then steer them to support a politician who puts himself up as a though-leader on the subject.  The game is to capture votes.

text:
IMHO climate change movement is political, taxing carbon is nothing more than kleptocracy. Driving down atmospheric carbon dioxide is damaging to life. Why? Because lowering carbon dioxide concentration in the atmosphere slows growth and even kills flora and fauna growth. Both mars and Venus have very high CO2 concentrations in their atmospheres whereas in between these two planets there is earth with only 0.04%. That low carbon dioxide concentration is due to flora that converts carbon dioxide to oxygen and ties up carbon via photosynthesis. So flora optimises the climate to suit life very effectively, far more effectively than humans can. Supporting plant life is philanthropic and is the way to go.  

Carbon tax is lethal for the populations of poor countries and it is thus a bad idea. The more expensive green energy leaves less money for food. Lower carbon dioxide levels reduce crop yields resulting in more deaths. On the other hand photosynthesis is endothermic. It reduces the ambient temperature when the sun shines and the is carbon dioxide in the air - the more carbon dioxide the faster plants metabolise it. Carbon dioxide is essential for life, the more the better up to 4000 ppm (0.4%). 

Fortunately the USA rejects the Paris accord and is doing the right thing - feeding and supporting flora, growing more trees.

text: Yes of course, all these natural disasters, floods, droughts, wildfires, hurricanes, heat waves etc. are of great concern. However. Will someone please explain how an increase of only 1 degree centigrade over a period of roughly 100 years could possibly produce all these extreme effects. Average temperatures on our planet currently range from -25 degrees Celsius in the arctic regions to 45 degrees Celsius at the equator, so how can an increase of only 1 degree make that much of a difference? Also if we consider the history, we learn of similar conditions, including very serious floods, droughts, wildfires, hurricanes, etc. during periods when average global temperatures were considerably cooler. Sorry but I just don't get it.

text:
Ok, so I find this segment completely amusing...

Forest fires CAN be diminished by something called clearing. Cleaning the forest of brush and dead trees. Doing managed burns and even clearing some trees in a line that can stop the fire from traveling.  These articles support this:

https://www.nature.org/en-us/about-us/where-we-work/united-states/idaho/stories-in-idaho/wildfires-and-forest-management/

https://www.globalchange.gov/browse/multimedia/effectiveness-forest-management-reducing-wildfire-risk

So who is in control of the areas in question? Democrats. 
Who didn't do enough preparation and preventative maintenance? Democrats. 
Who, AGAIN, is trying to pass the blame? Democrats. 
Is global warming an issue? Yes
Is global warming the ONLY factor? Not in the least. 
Poor management of lands and not taking preventative steps are the main factor here. Native Americans did better for our lands than we ever have. This entire article is a waste of time. If your smart, i hope you will do your own research. Trump 2020
